quest.name: Pushy for Patronage
journal:
 Quest Sync
Eo An seeks aid for an ill friend.
objectives: Deliver the sprigs of Voeburtwort to Iala Oul.

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: I'm loath to trouble a visitor such as you, but will you not lend me a hand?

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: You see, a friend of mine is unwell. Accidentally consumed a poisonous plant, it would seem.

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: A Nu Mou named Iala Oul makes a medicine that can purge the poison. I would take myself to Pla Enni for it, but I dare not leave my friend's side. If you could go in my stead, I would be in your debt.

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: It's the Nu Mou named Iala Oul that makes the medicine. If you could go to Pla Enni and obtain it for me, I would be in your debt.

dialogue.name: IALAOUL
dialogue.text: An amaro is unwell, you say? But of course I would be happy to help. Nu Mou or no, I would not forsake those in need.

dialogue.name: IALAOUL
dialogue.text: That being said, as per our custom, I must ask for a fitting payment. Let's see... Yes, four sprigs of Voeburtwort should suffice.

dialogue.name: IALAOUL
dialogue.text: The herb grows in abundance outside the cave in Voeburtenburg. Bring them to me, and I will see that the ailing amaro has his medicine.

dialogue.name: IALAOUL
dialogue.text: Voeburtwort grows in abundance around Voeburtenburg. Bring it to me, and I will see that the ailing amaro has his medicine.

dialogue.name: IALAOUL
dialogue.text: Ah, you're back. Do you have the Voeburtwort?

dialogue.name: IALAOUL
dialogue.text: Ah, four sprigs, precisely as requested. This will replace the amount I used to make the medicine, which I should mention has already been delivered to Wolekdorf. It wouldn't do to make the sick and ailing wait, after all.

dialogue.name: IALAOUL
dialogue.text: But I must say─and perhaps I'm simply imagining it─even though the amaro I met with was appreciative, there was an aloofness about him at the same time. At any rate, the honorable task is done, and to great satisfaction for all.

dialogue.name: IALAOUL
dialogue.text: If you require anything else, do not hesitate to let me know.

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: Yes, Iala Oul indeed came earlier with the medicine. I gave it to my friend at once, and already he is feeling better. Thank you so much for procuring the herbs.

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: Now, forgive me if this seems like prying...but how do you find dealing with Iala Oul?

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: Truly? You are a far more patient soul than I am.

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: Every time I meet Iala Oul, or indeed most other Nu Mou, they never fail to ask if something ails me. Even when I say no, they press me, again and again.

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: I realize it is simply the way with them, but it becomes overbearing very quickly. And that ails me. Thus do I make a point of keeping my distance with them.

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: You should keep your distance as well, lest you be drawn deep into their endless web of tasks.
